Class ec.pl.runtime.UnumDefinition 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.pl.runtime.UnumDefinition
public class UnumDefinition
extends Object
The description of a particular variety of unum. Assumes a host/client presence model and a fixed set of ingredient roles, but omits the actual choice of implementations for the ingredients themselves.

UnumDefinition(int)
Construct a new unum definition.

addClientPresenceInterface(Class, String)
Declare an interface in the client-side presence interface.
addClientPresenceInterface(String, String)
Declare a message in the client-side presence interface.
addClientPresenceMessage(String, String)
Declare a message in the client-side presence interface.
addHostPresenceInterface(Class, String)
Declare an interface in the host-side presence interface.
addHostPresenceInterface(String, String)
Declare a message in the host-side presence interface.
addHostPresenceMessage(String, String)
Declare a message in the host-side presence interface.
addIngredientRole(String, boolean)
Declare the role name of one of the ingredients
addInterface(Class, String, IntTable, boolean)
Add a new interface to one of the several message arrays.
addPresenceInterface(Class, String)
Declare an interface in all presence interfaces.
addPresenceInterface(String, String)
Declare an interface in all presence interfaces.
addPresenceMessage(String, String)
Declare a message in all presence interfaces.
addUnumInterface(Class, String)
Declare an interface in the unum presence interface.

UnumDefinition 
 public UnumDefinition(int ingredientRoleCount)
Construct a new unum definition. The result will still be in creation mode.

Parameters:
ingredientRoleCount - The number of ingredient roles it will have
unumMessageCount - The number of messages in the unum interface
hostPresenceMessageCount - The number of messages in the host-side presence interface
clientPresenceMessageCount - The number of messages in the client-side presence interface

createUnum 
 public Unum createUnum()
Create a new unum that matches this definition. The newly created unum will itself be returned in create mode and will not have any ingredients associated with it.

finishDefinition 
 public void finishDefinition()
Terminate creation mode. Called by the unum definition creator to indicate that it has added all the ingredient roles and messages.

addInterface 
 public void addInterface(Class intf,
                          String ingredient,
                          IntTable messagesTable,
                          boolean replace) throws UnumException
Add a new interface to one of the several message arrays. First, the super class of intf, if any, is added as an interface, then any interfaces which intf implements are added, and finally all public methods on intf itself are added. Note that interfaces or classes may be passed into this procedure.

Parameters:
intf - The Class of the interface to add
ingredient - The role name of the ingredient to deliver it to
messagesTable - The message IntTable to add the message to
replace - Boolean to determine whether or not to replace a message in the table if it is already routed
Throws: UnumException
from ensureOpenDefinition()
Throws: UnumException
from addMessage()

 public void encode(RtEncoder encoder) throws UnumException
Encode this definition.

Parameters:
encoder - The encoder to encode into
Throws: UnumException
when an encoding error occurs
